root.name: Meccha! Taiko no Tatsujin DS: 7-tsu no Shima no Daibouken
root.description: OverviewMechha! Taiko no Tatsujin DS is a rhythm game developed by Namco and published by Nintendo released for the Ninendo DS and is the sequel to Taiko no Tatsujin. Like the other games in the series, the player plays the notes of a chosen song's drum part as they are displayed on the screen. The game can be played with the touch screen or buttons. The game also has up to 4 player local wireless multiplayer and comes with two drum styli to be used as drum sticks.Song ListJ-pop PEACH (Ai Otsuka) 愛唄 (GReeeeN) アゲ♂アゲ♂EVERY☆騎士 (DJ Ozma) Lifetime Respect -女編- (RSP) Ikenai Taiyō (イケナイ太陽) (Orange Range) Tentai Kansoku (天体観測) (Bump of Chicken) Love so sweet (Arashi) Linda Linda (リンダリンダ) (The Blue Hearts)Video game musicShiny Smile (The Idolm@ster: Live For You!)エージェント夜を往く (The Idolm@ster: Live For You!)バンビーニ (Mojipittan)恋はみずいろ (Mizuiro Blood) (unlockable)スペランカー (Spelunker)Ridge Racer (unlockable)Brave Sword, Braver Soul (Soulcalibur II)ドラゴンスビリﾂトメドレー (Dragon Spirit) (unlockable)Namco original七色ハーモニー (Main game theme)太鼓侍 (unlockable)わすれなぐさゴーゴー・キッチン (unlockable)ヌムジカac.10 (unlockable)百花繚乱 (unlockable)われら無敵のドコン団 (unlockable)闇の魂 (unlockable)さいたま2000 (unlockable)EkiBEN2000 (unlockable)ClassicalBoléro (Maurice Ravel)Rhapsody in Blue (George Gershwin) (unlockable)Carmen (Georges Bizet)La Campanella (Franz Liszt)カレ・カノ・カノン (Kare Kano) (unlockable)(Pachelbel's Canon)March (Tchaikovsky)Symphony No. 5 (Ludwig van Beethoven)New World Symphony (Antonín Dvořák)The Entertainer (Scott Joplin)Classic Medley (Rock version) (unlockable)Parade of the Wooden Soldiers (Leon Jessel)TraditionalAlphabet songYankee DoodleAnimeアンパンマンたいそう (Soreike!
